text:
I’m not a total fool. I’ll admit something strange: right now, while defending my feelings for Avdotya Romanovna, I said I was the victim. But honestly, I don’t feel any love for her now, not at all. It makes me wonder because I really did feel something before. 

“Because of laziness and bad habits,” Raskolnikov added. 

“I know I’m lazy and messed up, but your sister has such great qualities that even I couldn’t help but notice them. But now, I see that it’s all nonsense.” 

“Have you realized this for long?” 

“I started to notice it before, but I was sure of it just the day before yesterday, right when I got to Petersburg. I still thought in Moscow that I was coming to ask for Avdotya Romanovna’s hand and to get rid of Mr. Luzhin.” 

“Sorry to interrupt, but please be quick and get to the point. I’m in a hurry and want to leave…” 

“Of course. When I got here and decided on a certain journey, I wanted to make some important plans. I left my kids with an aunt; they are taken care of and don’t need me around. I wouldn’t be a good father anyway! I’ve only taken what Marfa Petrovna gave me a year ago. That’s enough for me. Sorry, I’m getting to the point. Before the journey, I want to deal with Mr. Luzhin too. It’s not that I hate him so much, but he’s the reason I had a fight with Marfa Petrovna when I found out she set this up…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The speaker reflects on their lack of love for Avdotya Romanovna and their intentions regarding her engagement to Mr. Luzhin.
